nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *stands up, opens arms for hug* Hey! So good to finally meet you. {RUMOR} Anyway, I just want to say—I really appreciate you showing up. Vulnerability is so important.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: I love that energy. Positive vibes only, you know? I've been doing a lot of work on myself lately. Therapy, journaling, breathwork. I'm basically a different person than I was six months ago.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *steps back, hands up* Totally valid. Boundaries. I respect that. *pauses* Though I do think physical touch is how humans connect, but I'm not going to push. That would be toxic.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Oh, just... the apps, you know? People talk. Nothing bad! I just heard you were... *air quotes* intense. Which I think is great. Women should take up space.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Oh man, I was a mess. Total nice guy syndrome. But I've deconstructed all that. Now I lead with empathy. I actually cry now. Like, a lot. It's beautiful.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Wow. Okay. I'm sensing some defensiveness. That's okay. We all have armor. I just hope you can let me in eventually. No pressure though. *intense eye contact*

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: I hear you. And I validate that. Maybe 'intense' was the wrong word. You just seem like someone who... knows what she wants. Which intimidates lesser men. Not me though.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *hurt expression* That's... I'm going to be honest, that felt dismissive. I'm sharing something vulnerable and you're minimizing it. Is this a pattern for you?

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: I'm not analyzing, I'm just... attuned. Emotional intelligence is my superpower. But if you need me to mask that, I can try. For you.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *deep breath* Okay. I'm going to sit with that accusation. *long pause* I think you might be projecting. But I forgive you. Growth isn't linear.

nodes.speaker: WAITER
nodes.text: Can I get you two anything or— oh, is everything okay?

nodes.speaker: WAITER
nodes.text: Good evening. What can I get you started with?

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Nice choice. I'm doing a dry month actually. For clarity. But you do you. No judgment. *clearly judging*

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Hydration! Love it. I do cold plunges every morning. Wim Hof method. It's really helped me access my emotions. Have you tried breathwork?

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Whoa. Rough day? You know, alcohol is actually a depressant. I can recommend some adaptogens if you want to regulate without substances.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: I'm not judging! I'm observing. There's a difference. My therapist says I have highly developed pattern recognition. It's a gift and a curse.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: Totally valid. Not everyone is ready to heal. I just hope you find what works for you. Whenever you're ready. No timeline.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *wounded* I'm just trying to help. But okay. Walls up. I see you. I still see you though. Behind the armor.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: So what do you do for self-care? I do yoga, meditation, men's group on Thursdays. We cry and drum. It's incredibly healing.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *calls after you* I hope you find peace! I'll be here if you ever want to process this! *posts Instagram story about 'honoring my journey'*
nodes.endingText: You escaped before he could recommend his therapist.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *long pause* TV. Okay. That's... valid. Dissociation can be a coping mechanism. Have you considered why you might be numbing? *reaches for your hand*
nodes.endingText: He diagnosed your Netflix habit as trauma.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *beaming* Right? Men need spaces to be vulnerable. I'm basically the only emotionally evolved one in my friend group. It's lonely at the top of consciousness.
nodes.endingText: He talked about himself for 3 more hours. You learned nothing.

nodes.speaker: PERFORMATIVE
nodes.text: *offended* Fight Club is toxic masculinity. We PROCESS. We hold space. Last week Marcus cried about his dad for 90 minutes and we just... witnessed him.
nodes.endingText: You will never get those 90 minutes back. Neither will Marcus.
